availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Bedford Trimble Co Ky
Oct 19th 1863
Dear Sir
I take the liberty to enclose to you for my friends two Petitions. The one of Thos McIntosh is for an old man 70 years of age do pardon him!!!
The other is a poor young man as represented.

I was one of your supporters throughout the election, have stood up to the Union, in Rebellious Trimble and never have nor never will swerve from that good cause, I beg leave to defer you to judge Drane J. L. Scott prosecuting attorney and Saml E Dehaven representative from Oldham, & Col Buckley.
The fine in both cases are small, and the bearer Mr W. F. Peck is well acquainted with them and is or will be our clerk any representations he makes I will vouch for

Respite each case 6 months
Tho E Bramlette

His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky
Petition for Remissions on Scott Atty for Comth
